comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Williston graphic., April 06, 1916, Image 3, column 3 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn88076270/1916-04-06/ed-... reports that Japan might return the Sagami and the Soya (pictured nearby in the Bain stream) to Russia so that Russia could join the British and Japanese in the bombardment of Tsing-tau. The Sagami was the former Peresviet (also written Peresvet in transliteration), captured at Port Arthur. She was "a battleship of 12,674 tons" and carried four 12-inch guns.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peresvet-class_battleship states that she was sold back to the Russians and sank in the Mediterranean in early 1917 after hitting German mines.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: An article in the Honolulu star-bulletin., February 26, 1916, 3:30 Edition, Page 16., column 3, "RUSSIA BUYS BACK CAPTURED BATTLESHIPS" says that the sale was the result of the visit of George Mikhailovich of Russia to Japan. A photo of the visit: see comments there.
